Deficiency Narrative: Record of TB screening was not observed to be present in one employee file.
Correction Narrative: The operation emailed a copy of the employee's TB Screening along with the following corrective action: Effective immediately, we will be conducting an audit of all active employee files to ensure they contain all required and up-to-date documentation. The employee file cabinet will be rekeyed to restrict unauthorized access. We are currently implementing an electronic record system that will enable us to track and manage documentation more efficiently. This system will provide automated notifications for any missing or outdated information, ensuring our files remain in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Annual trainings that included Trauma Informed Care, Psychotropic Medication Normalcy, and Suicide were all found to be delinquent for one employee.
Correction Narrative: The operation emailed the following corrective action: Effective immediately, we will be conducting an audit of all active employee files to ensure they contain all required and up-to-date documentation. The employee file cabinet will be rekeyed to restrict unauthorized access. We are currently implementing an electronic record system that will enable us to track and manage documentation more efficiently. This system will provide automated notifications for any missing or outdated information, ensuring our files remain in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Two service plans reviewed contained the same needs for both children.
Correction Narrative: Ensuring that each service plan is tailored to a child's specific circumstances is a priority, and we are taking steps to prevent this issue from recurring.  Additionally, the individual responsible for the original plans is no longer employed with The One Discovery. Moving forward, we remain committed to maintaining high standards in service planning to ensure every child receives the care and support they need.

Deficiency Narrative: Based on the information gathered and obtained throughout the investigation it was determined a staff member slammed a child to the ground.
Correction Narrative: The standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation's child-care administrator position has been vacant since May 28, 2024.
Correction Narrative: The operation's child-care administrator position was filled in August 2024.

Deficiency Narrative: During interviews with the victim and staff members, it was discovered that the children in care are allowed to lay on and or sit closely with staff demonstrating inappropriate boundaries.
Correction Narrative: During interviews with the victim and staff members, it was discovered that the children in care are allowed to lay on and or sit closely with staff demonstrating inappropriate boundaries.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff member place knee on ribs while trying to conduct a restraint on a child in care.
Correction Narrative: Staff member place knee on ribs while trying to conduct a restraint on a child in care.

Deficiency Narrative: A child record reviewed did not have a signature on the admission assessment.
Correction Narrative: The correct document with the signature was not available during inspection but was later submitted. To ensure records are available upon request. Our records will be provided via a printed binder or access will be granted to our electronic records system to ensure timely access to records upon request.

Deficiency Narrative: A child record reviewed did not have a signature on the preliminary service plan.
Correction Narrative: The correct document with the signature was not available during inspection but was later submitted. To ensure records are available upon request. Our records will be provided via a printed binder or access will be granted to our electronic records system to ensure timely access to records upon request.

Deficiency Narrative: A review of a staff files has no employee reference checks documented.
Correction Narrative:
The operation submitted proof of employee reference checks done prior to pre-employment. The following action has been taken: Each person hired after 8/09/2023 has their have their reference 
and checked up included with in their employment file.

Deficiency Narrative: Licensing arrived at the facility at 9:45 AM to conduct an unannounced monitoring inspection and was not provided records until 2 hours later. Several requested records were unavailable.
Correction Narrative: The following action has been taken: To ensure records are available upon request. Our records will be provided via a printed binder or access will be granted to our electronic records system to ensure timely access to records upon request

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple children in care stated children are subjected to profane language.
Correction Narrative: CORRECTIVE ACTION PLAN: The One Discovery has conducted a training class on appropriate communication techniques and the impact of language on children. Encourage the use of positive reinforcement and constructive feedback.  Implement a monitoring plan to ensure that the individual adheres to appropriate behavior moving forward.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff did not exhibit prudent judgement when they did not attempt to de-escalate or restrain a child in care ready to harm themselves, property, or others.
Correction Narrative: CORRECTIVE ACTION PLAN: Schedule regular check-ins to discuss progress, address any ongoing issues, and provide constructive feedback. Use these meetings to reinforce positive changes and offer additional support if needed. Ensure the employee is fully aware of and understands all relevant policies and procedures related to professional behavior and responsibilities. Staff regular de-escalate and redirect the youth to prevent them from harming themselves and others.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff did not exhibit accountability or awareness when they allowed a child to elope from the facility.
Correction Narrative:
A physical follow up was conducted. One child and three caregivers were interviewed. No supervision concerns were noted.

CORRECTIVE ACTION PLAN: We aim to ensure the safety and well-being of all children in our care, while fostering a responsible and vigilant workforce committed to preventing such incidents in the future. Our youth has demonstrated the use of their coping skills which includes allowing them outside for walks or in the enclosed area. Many times, this de-escalates our youth without the use of restraint or any other incidents.

Deficiency Narrative: The children and staff state that the children were given over-the-counter vitamins, but there is no documentation of them.
Correction Narrative: All over the counter medications including vitamins will be recorded/logged.

Deficiency Narrative: Two staff members admit that they repeat the curse words that the children use against them.
Correction Narrative: Staff was given a training class on de-escalation 2/7/2024 to provide redirection, eliminate rephrasing, or better words choices.

Deficiency Narrative: Two of two children interviewed stated that they saw a staff member sleeping at night and one child requires 24-hour supervision.
Correction Narrative: The operation has implemented shift changes.

Deficiency Narrative: Two serious incidents occurred and where not documented as required by minimum standards.
Correction Narrative: Email received on 06/05/2024 stating that all serious incidents that occur are documented as required, reported to the casework, hotline as well as contacting the EMTs or police when necessary.

Deficiency Narrative: Child in care was able to access chemicals and ingest them.
Correction Narrative: Email was received on 06/05/2024 stating that stating the closet where our cleaning products are kept was changed the next morning to a dead bolt lock.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care required medical attention for allegedly ingesting bleach and the incident was not reported to the parent.
Correction Narrative: Email was provided on 06.05.2024 stated that the caseworker was notified in this incident with details with the police incident number and hotline report number. This information is provided via text, voicemail and email.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care required medical attention for allegedly ingesting bleach and the incident was not reported to licensing.
Correction Narrative: Email was received on 06/05/2024 stating that this was a serious incident report and was reported to the hotline, the police and EMT were contacted. All serious incidents are reported to the hot line and other professional service providers as soon as possible.

Deficiency Narrative: An overnight caregiver did not follow the operation's 24 Hour Continuous Supervision policy when they were found to be asleep while present at the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation has implemented shift changes.

Deficiency Narrative: An unauthorized individual is present at the operation and has direct access to children in care.
Correction Narrative: An unauthorized individual was deactivated from CBCU 02/14/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: Overnight operation staff failed to provide adequate supervision due to the staff sleeping while on duty.
Correction Narrative: The operation has implemented shift changes.

Deficiency Narrative:
Regarding IMPACT case # 49930701, information in class stated that the AWOL incident occurred on 12-24-23 but was reported to the hotline on 12-26-23 at 5:40pm.

Regarding IMPACT case # 49930963 (Merged), in formation in class stated that the AWOL occurred on 12-23-23 but was reported to the hotline on 12-27-23 at 6:44am
Correction Narrative: CORRECTIVE ACTION:  AWOL reporting is serious at The One Discovery.  ALL residents not at their designated location up for pick up or elopement are reported promptly to the appropriate authorities, reporting to the hot line and texting, calling and following up with and email to the caseworker.  These actions are taken immediately.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff open the door and encourage the children to walk out while they are attempting to run away.
Correction Narrative:
CORRECTIVE ACTION PLAN
The following action will be taken: The staff does not encourage the youth to walk out. When a youth indicate getting fresh air is part of their coping skill to calm down. The youth under the watchful supervision of the direct care staff can and will be utilized. This action will allow the youth to de-escalate without restraint, assault on staff members, bodily inquire or property damage. This decision will be made prudently and on a case by case bases.

Deficiency Narrative: The unauthorized annual summary log does not include the intake report number for the report made to the hotline, it does not have the child's age as required in 748.453(a)(1) in addition does not indicate how long the child was gone for as required in 748.453(a)(3).
Correction Narrative:
CORRECTIVE ACTION PLAN
The following action has been taken: The age of the child has been added and was the only information missing from the Annual AWOL Summary Log. All other information was being recorded.

Deficiency Narrative: It was confirmed that children in care were not wearing seat belts while being transported in a vehicle.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided a follow- up response. The operation stated that when transporting children staff will ensure that children are properly secured and the number of children in the vehicle will not exceed the seating capacity. A second vehicle will be utilized if needed to ensure that all children are properly secured while in a vehicle. Staff will ensure that all children remain in their seats and seat belted until the behicle arrives at its destination.

Deficiency Narrative: The current treatment director did not have a background chick on file. The treatment director is currently hired as a contractor and is assisting the operation with the treatment services they provide.
Correction Narrative: On 12/22/2021 the operation submitted a background check for Bobby Price, Treatment Director. According to CLASS there Bobby Price in Eligible and the background check is complete.

Deficiency Narrative: During a walk through inspection the freezer in the storage room was at two degrees Fahrenheit. The freezer was brought down to zero degrees after the operation staff was notified.
One out of three staff records did not include TB screening documentation in the staff record. The TB record was provided by the administrator once they were notified it was not in the record.
A caregiver admitted to not completing documentation of serious incident.
Correction Narrative: The One Discovery RTC LCCA will complete a documentation training with all staff to ensure all serious incidents are documented and turned in to the administrator by 9:00 am the next morning.  Once submitted, all incidents will be reviewed by the LCCA to ensure all documentation is thorough and completed prior to being filed in the client binder. This training will be completed by all staff by January 27, 2022.  A copy of the training roster will be kept in the Administrators office for review.
